snippet: Companies are creating words and symbols that are gaining recognition on the Web and followers. Examples include the “like” of Facebook and the abbreviation LOL (laugh out loud).
abstract: Jenna Wortham Bits column comments on the language of technology and social networking; observes that companies are creating words and symbols that are gaining recognition, including the 'like' of Facebook and the abbreviation LOL (laugh out loud); notes that LOL and OMG are included in the Oxford English Dictionary.
lead_paragraph: Companies are creating words and symbols that are gaining recognition on the Web and followers. Examples include the “like” of Facebook and the abbreviation LOL (laugh out loud).

headline.seo: Creating a Language for the Web
headline.main: Coining Terminology for Life on the Web
headline.print_headline: Coining Terminology for Life on the Web
